enValue: Initial basemap to load. If not supplied, viewer will select the first basemap in the basemaps list.
The zoom level when zooming to a point feature (e.g. when using the zoom button in the datagrid). Must be a positive integer.
The amount of throttling (in milliseconds) to be used for the map mouse move event. A value of 0 means no throttle.
The list of basemaps to be made available via the basemap selector. Minimum one is required.
Key-value dictionary where the key is the tile schema id and the value is the basemap. When duplicate tile schema id's are provided, the latest entry will be used.
The tile schema associated with this basemap.
A unique id identifying the basemap.
Name of the basemap used for labeling.
Description of the basemap. Becomes visible when basemap selector is expanded.
Alt text for the basemap thumbnail image.
The hex code representing the background colour of the basemap.
Path to image file to display in the basemap selector.
When enabled, hides the basemap thumbnail image, leaving just the text component.
A set of URLs which should be composited to form a basemap entry. Stacked in ascending order, i.e. the first layer sits at the bottom and the last layer at the top.
A unique id identifying the basemap's layer.
The basemap layer's opacity. Must be a number between 0 and 1.
Custom attribution and logo for associated basemap when selected.
Properties to help define attribution text.
Contains the attribution value. If empty, it will use copyright text from the server.
Specifies if basemap attribution text is disabled.
Properties to help define attribution logo.
URL to go to when image is clicked.
Specifies if basemap attribution logo is disabled.
A unique combination of an LOD and an extent set (each basemap must fit into a tile schema).
A unique id identifying the tile schema.
The name to display in the basemap selector for the set of basemaps referencing this schema.
Identification link to extent set data defined in map.extentSets.
Identification link to lod set data defined in map.lodSets.
The comma separated list of two horizontally-adjacent tile URLs used to create the basemap thumbnail. URLs take the form of '/tile/LOD ID/VERTICAL TILE INDEX/HORIZONTAL TILE INDEX'.
The levels of detail (zoom scales) available for the map.
Level of details for a tile schema (i.e. zoom scales).
A unique id identifying the lod set.
The default, full and maximum extents of the map.
A unique id identifying the extent set.
The full extent; default will be used if not supplied.
The maximum extent; full or default extents will be used if not supplied.
Configuration for the components in the map caption bar
ID of the initial mouse point formatter
Specifies if map coordinates are disabled
Specifies if the scale bar should use imperial scale units
Specifies if the scale bar is disabled
Whether to disable language toggle within RAMP
